text: are you tired of hearing the same
methods over and over again about how to
increase your happiness in life you
should meditate go for a walk watch a
movie be present these are all efforts
many of us have tried and tested and
while there are reasons as to why
they're so popular I want to talk to you
today about some more unique
scientifically proven ways you can
increase the overall happiness and
quality of your life let's get right
into it our first tip is about synthetic
happiness synthetic happiness is a
concept made Popular by psychologist Dan
Gilbert it refers to the idea that we
can create our own happiness rather than
relying on external circumstances to
make us happy the truth is we have more
control over our own happiness than we
might think we do if you think back to a
moment when you are disappointed about
something not going the way you had
originally planned you might have been
unhappy at first but eventually you
moved on and found happiness in other
areas of your life synthetic happiness
doesn't rely on good events happening in
our life to make us happy but instead is
a type of Happy penis we create for
ourselves even when we don't get what we
want so how can we achieve this
synthetic happiness well one of the best
ways to cultivate this type of happiness
is by changing our mindset instead of
focusing on what we don't have we can
focus on what we do have and create
happiness from that this means being
grateful for what we have and finding
joy in the simple things in life there
are a few ways to do this such as
keeping a Daily Journal praying working
on slowing down to appreciate the little
things or practicing gratitude which
brings us on to our next tip giving to
others researchers have found that
giving to others even just a small
amount boosts social connections and
happiness in both the giver and the
receiver a study by psychologists from
the University of Chicago gave 96
participants five dollars each day for
five days to spend on others half the
participants were randomly assigned to
spend the money on themselves and the
other half were asked to spend it on
someone else this could be things like
putting the money in a tip jar or donate
to a charity online the participants who
gave the money away self-reported their
levels of happiness to be higher by the
end of the study than those that spent
the money on themselves giving in these
little ways has a bigger effect on our
happiness than we realize when we give
to others we activate pleasure centers
in our brain that release dopamine this
promotes a natural high which can last
much longer than the fleeting pleasure
we get from buying material things so
the next time you're able to consider
leaving a tip or look up ways you can
help a local charity the third tip is to
invest in your time money can't buy
happiness but it can bring more
stability and comfort you don't have to
earn loads of money or be on a high
income to invest in your time you can
invest in small ways to make areas of
your life easier to manage less
stressful and become a happier person
because of it for example if you hate
cleaning and you don't like spending
hours of your time to keep your space
tidy you could hire a cleaner they can
spend a few hours each week scrubbing
the bathtub or doing the dishes and you
get your energy back to spend on the
things you do enjoy you can invest in a
meal subscription box to be delivered
straight to your door no more empty
cupboards or spending too long at the
grocery store and instead you get to do
what matters to you most like calling a
friend or starting a new hobby these
things won't cost too much of your
hard-earned cash so if it's in your
budget try investing in your time like
this you don't have to go haul Leo
DiCaprio and Wolf of Wall Street with
your Investments honestly you could
change your financial future with the
right bit of research because the most
legendary investors didn't build their
fortunes overnight they found exclusive
long-term Investments the issue for
People Like Us was that these
opportunities would only come with years
of research and building strong
relationships the average person just
didn't have time or access to these
spaces but luckily for us we can still
take notes from the wealthy strategy and
with that in mind the next time you have
a little time go check out our newest
sponsor Masterworks Masterworks team of
art nerds and financial analysts use
their years of experience to give you
access to an investment that the world's
wealthiest people have collected for
decades it's Contemporary Art see the
last few years have been a roller
coaster for most public Investments but
in that time today's sponsor Masterworks
sold over 45 million dollars worth of
Art and distributed the net proceeds to
their investors adding to an already
impressive track record it's no surprise
that over 650 000 people have signed up
so far and demand is growing by the day
so there is a wait list but our
subscribers can skip it and start
collecting today by clicking the link in
the description down below and that
brings us to our final tip personalizing
your environment research by happiness
expert Dr Gillian mandich has found that
there is a direct link between the
control we have over our environment and
our happiness levels therefore people
who control their surroundings are
happier than those that don't one of the
fastest ways to work on your happiness
is by personalizing your environment
with things that make you happy so how
can you do this if you enjoy looking at
beautiful things like art plants fresh
flowers or even a fish tank adding these
things to your environment will help
make the space feel more like yours
giving you a feeling of more control but
also raising your general sense of
Happiness when you see the things that
bring you Joy lighting is often a big
factor in your surroundings too rooms
with a lot of natural light are great
for productivity but you can also get
creative with lighting your space using
lamps or colored lighting to help create
a calm and vibrant atmosphere another
Factor we can control is what we listen
to putting on music or background sounds
can increase mood and productivity and
the best part is that you can listen to
whatever you want whether that be Lo-Fi
beats or heavy metal our surroundings
and how we experience them are so
important and these are just a few ways
we can control and personalize our space
give them a try and see how controlling
your environment can help boost your
mood and that's it I hope these tips
have been helpful let me know in the
comments which tip you're going to
incorporate into your routine to boost
your happiness until next time
